content.description:
Tilt Boulder: 

  Locate "WMHD" by walking around to the far right side of the boulder (when looking at the downhill road facing front main face this will be on the far right end) 

  "WMHD" Sit starts on the low ledge/jug. Work straight up through slopers and knob to flat ledge to gain the easy top out.
content.location:
Tilt Boulder: 

  walk around to the far right side of the boulder (when looking at the downhill road facing front main face this will be on the far right end)

content.description: Sit-start in the middle of the boulder, to the right of the two trees on a lower, nice jug. feet will be slightly to the left.   Pull up through a series of mack daddy ledges and blocks and top out above.
content.location: Sit-start in the middle of the boulder, to the right of the two trees

content.description: Sit Start between the two trees on the mid-left portion of the Tilt Boulder. start on low hands and follow straight up, staying between the two trees and never using any hands that are beyond them. think of the trees as the yellow lines on the road...    move through slopy, bad hands to the top out.
content.location: on the Tilt boulder; sit starting, climbing up, and topping out between the only two trees growing directly next to Tilt.

content.description: Start to the left of the boulder. to the left of the obvious, two small trees growing next to the boulder. look for the large, diagonal cut out ledge at the bottom, and this is the sit start and heel hook to start with.   Pick up and throw to the good rail above.   At this point, instead of traversing in to the rail to the left, go straight up using the smaller, this flake rail/seam and topping out directly above.
content.location: Start to the left of the boulder. to the left of the obvious, two small trees growing next to the boulder. look for the large, diagonal cut out ledge at the bottom, and this is the sit start and heel hook to start with.

content.description: walk to the far right end of the Tilt Boulder. Find the thin shelf ledge that juts out and this is the short little nothing line that limbs across it. Sit start under the shelf. Toss up and climb over it to top out above... dont do this one unless you've exhausted everything else on the boulder.

Start to the left of the boulder. to the left of the obvious, two small trees growing next to the boulder. look for the large, diagonal cut out ledge at the bottom, and this is the sit start and heel hook to start with.   Pick up and toss to the good rail above. traverse this rail into another, and finish out on a flat top out basket to the left. find the good ledge behind it to use.
content.location: Start to the left of the boulder. to the left of the obvious, two small trees growing next to the boulder. look for the large, diagonal cut out ledge at the bottom, and this is the sit start and heel hook to start with.

content.description: Sit-start in the middle of the boulder on a massive, obvious, side-pull block.   Using the side-pull and top of the block, stand up and hit the ledge above. Heel-hook the side pull and press up. use foot work and get to the top directly above.
content.location: Sit-start in the middle of the boulder on a massive, obvious, side-pull block.

content.description:
Walk to the right hand end of the boulder. As it curves to the right look for the diagonal, right trending, and subtle, blunt, short arête. 

  Sit start low on a thin right crimp and left hand on the low sloper below the blunt slopey arête. A good, far left foot will help with the first few moves. 

  Bump up through the slopers along the arete and hit the higher crimp under the arete and go for the top.

Start to the far left of the boulder under the overhanging nose on a good lip for both hands.   Get feet far and under the boulder, on the very bottom part of the boulder. toss up to the lip of the boulder, and traverse right to good hands. top out.
content.location: Start to the far left of the boulder under the overhanging nose

content.description: The Tilt Boulder is so much fun.It is one of the first few boulders you walk to in the Middle Boneyard. It has mostly easy to beginner problems, with one line being a v6. The left overhand has the best lines, "Tilt-A-Whirl" & "Tilt-A-Nose". Its namesake comes from the long slanted stripes. Come out and have fun!
